newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador registers $70 mln May trade surplus.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador registers $70 mln May trade surplus.

text.p: Ecuador registered a $70 million trade surplus in May, compared with a $169 million surplus in the same month last year and a $34 million trade surplus this April, the Central Bank said Tuesday.
Exports totaled $410 million in May, up 0.99 percent from April. Imports were $340 million, down 8.6 percent from April.
Oil sector exports totaled $130 million, up 17.1 percent from April.
Ecuador ran up a $309 million trade surplus over the first five months of the year, down from a $453 million surplus over the same period last year.
Exports totaled $2.0 billion and imports $1.7 billion from January to May.
Banana exports totaled $594 million from January to May, crude oil exports $576 million and shrimp exports $291 million.
